meanings.definition: A class of phospholipids that are a major component of cell membranes.
meanings.sent1: Phosphatidyls help make up the walls of cells.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how phosphatidyls form cell boundaries.
meanings.sent3: The phosphatidyls in the cell membrane were having a party, bouncing around happily.
meanings.sent4: The phosphatidyls stood like soldiers, guarding the cell's secrets.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the phosphatidyls looked like tiny building blocks holding the cell together.

meanings.definition: A type of lipid that contains a phosphate group.
meanings.sent1: The body needs phosphatidyls to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: Phosphatidyls play a crucial role in the body's functions.
meanings.sent3: The phosphatidyls in the blood were chatting with the other lipids.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved as swiftly as phosphatidyls in the body.
meanings.sent5: The phosphatidyls acted like messengers, carrying important signals throughout the body.
